instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board with problem. when i press power button fan spin for second and stop after nothing happen. any idea? aha. i bought this laptop with faulty magsafe. when i got it there was no green light on charger. i replaced macsafe board and now i have green light

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message:
The faulty magsafe maybe killed the charging circuit or the charger sense circuit.
What voltage do you get on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Resistance between pins 17-18 and between pins 27-28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: i checked straight away that first and is ok :  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> -8.43v    resistance also good  pin 27-28: 20.5ohm    and 17-18:  3.1ohm

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: Power good issue then I bet.  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> coming high, if not find the rail that is missing.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: is this voltage should be show when computer is of? <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3_FET</SIGNAL>  also i have missing  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_REG</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> must come high if the fan spins.....
